Orbs represent care reactions and comments given to confessions about loneliness between March 15 and Nov. 4.

1 comment, by a top commenter

1 care reaction

Placements are approximate.

5 care reactions

1 comment, not by a top commenter

Bar lengths represent the number of posts about loneliness or isolation posted on a given day.

March 15, 2021

April

2021

While the median number of care reacts for posts with negative, positive, and neutral-sentiments was zero, the median number of care reacts for a post about loneliness and isolation was six.

 

In addition, on average, posts about loneliness and isolation had 11.5 times the number of care reacts as neutral-sentiment posts, and over three times the number of care reacts as positive-sentiment posts.

 

May 2021

June 2021

11817. dreading coming back to campus :( I feel like no one I meet wants to be friends :( I’m tired of putting myself out there with no result :( how many more clubs do I have to join I’m in 5 already :(

July 2021

In anticipation of the fall 2021 semester, multiple confessions shared anxieties about making connections in person and experiencing isolation on campus.

11887. I already feel alone on campus and its been 1 week since I’ve been here. I don’t know what to do... it’s so weird never having been to campus but also not being a freshman.

August 2021

September

2021

11949. In all these years I’ve never sat with anyone at Low Steps since I have no friends. It’s some the loneliest moments of my time here.

October

2021

On average, 65 percent of comments were from those among the top ten percent of commenters by comment count. In addition, 66 percent of posts had at least one comment from someone who does not regularly comment on posts.
